parameters.name: maxcount

parameters.name: appid
parameters.description: AppID to retrieve news for

parameters.name: maxlength
parameters.description: Maximum length for the content to return, if this is 0 the full content is returned, if it's less then a blurb is generated to fit.

parameters.name: enddate
parameters.description: Retrieve posts earlier than this date (unix epoch timestamp)

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: # of posts to retrieve (default 20)

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter by (e.g. 'patchnodes')

parameters.description: Maximum length for the content to return, if this is 0 the full content is returned, if it's less then a blurb is generated to fit.

publishedfileids[0].description: collection ids to get the details for
published file id to look up

steamid.description: Should be the users steamid, unencrypted.

sessionkey.description: Should be a 32 byte random blob of data, which is then encrypted with RSA using the Steam system's public key.  Randomness is important here for security.

encrypted_loginkey.description: Should be the users hashed loginkey, AES encrypted with the sessionkey.

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: OAuth2 token for which to return details

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: GameID to retrieve the achievement percentages for

parameters.description: GameID to retrieve the achievement percentages for

parameters.name: appid
parameters.description: AppID that we're getting global stats for

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of stats get data for

parameters.name: name[0]
parameters.description: Names of stat to get data for

parameters.name: startdate
parameters.description: Start date for daily totals (unix epoch timestamp)

parameters.name: enddate
parameters.description: End date for daily totals (unix epoch timestamp)

parameters.name: appid
parameters.description: AppID that we're getting user count for

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: access key

message.description: Message that was last known to the user

secidletime.description: How many seconds is client considering itself idle, e.g. screen is off

use_accountids.description: Boolean, 0 (default): return steamid_from in output, 1: return accountid_from

parameters.name: input_json
parameters.description: An alternative to the request body; pass arguments as a URL-encoded JSON blob. The "key" and "format" fields should still be passed as separate parameters

rtmp_token.description: (Required) Valid RTMP token for the Broadcaster

frame_data.description: (Required) game data frame expressing current state of game (string, zipped, whatever)

parameters.name: cell_id
parameters.description: (Required) client Cell ID

parameters.name: max_servers
parameters.description: max servers in response list

parameters.name: ip_override
parameters.description: client IP address

parameters.description: launcher type

parameters.name: ipv6_public
parameters.description: client public ipv6 address if it knows it

parameters.name: input_json
parameters.description: An alternative to the request body; pass arguments as a URL-encoded JSON blob. The "key" and "format" fields should still be passed as separate parameters

parameters.name: input_json
parameters.description: An alternative to the request body; pass arguments as a URL-encoded JSON blob. The "key" and "format" fields should still be passed as separate parameters

appid.description: (Required) The appid to create the session for.

context.description: (Required) Game-specified context value the game can used to associate the session with some object on their backend.

title.description: (Required) The title of the session to be displayed within each user's list of sessions.

users.description: (Required) The initial state of all users in the session.

steamid.description: (Optional) steamid to make the request on behalf of -- if specified, the user must be in the session and all users being added to the session must be friends with the user.

parameters.name: input_json
parameters.description: An alternative to the request body; pass arguments as a URL-encoded JSON blob. The "key" and "format" fields should still be passed as separate parameters

appid.description: (Required) The appid of the session to update.

title.description: (Optional) The new title of the session.  If not specified, the title will not be changed.

users.description: (Optional) A list of users whose state will be updated to reflect the given state. If the users are not already in the session, they will be added to it.

steamid.description: (Optional) steamid to make the request on behalf of -- if specified, the user must be in the session and all users being added to the session must be friends with the user.

parameters.name: input_json
parameters.description: An alternative to the request body; pass arguments as a URL-encoded JSON blob. The "key" and "format" fields should still be passed as separate parameters

appid.description: (Required) The appid of the session to delete.

steamid.description: (Optional) steamid to make the request on behalf of -- if specified, the user must be in the session.
